content:
Yoga is a great form of exercise that offers many benefits for overall fitness and wellness. It helps improve flexibility, strength, and balance, and can also promote relaxation and reduce stress levels. However, depending on the type of yoga and intensity level, it may not always provide sufficient cardiorespiratory or aerobic benefits. 

If you are only doing yoga, I would recommend adding some form of aerobic exercise, such as brisk walking, running, swimming, or cycling, to your routine. This will help improve your cardiovascular health and overall fitness. Incorporating strength training exercises, such as lifting weights or using resistance bands, can also help improve muscle strength and tone. 

It's essential to find a balance between different forms of exercise that work best for your body and fitness goals. Consulting with a fitness professional or personal trainer can also be helpful in developing a well-rounded exercise program that takes into account your individual needs and goals.
